problem_text: Find FH if \triangle ABC \sim \triangle DEF, BG is an altitude of \triangle ABC, EH is an altitude of \triangle DEF, BG = 3, BF = 4, FC = 2, and CE = 1.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: FH, I on DF, ∠ICB, F on BE, ∠FHE, CI, DH ⊥ EH, 2 = CF, BG, I on AC, FI, I on FH, CE, CF, ∠FIC, H on DF, BG ⊥ CG, ∠ECI, G on AC, ∠CFD, BC, 3.14 = pi, EH ⊥ FH, ∠ACB, ∠HEB, 3 = BG, EF, C on BE, ∠CIH, HI, 1 = CE, F on BC, EH, ∠EFD, I on CG, △ABC ~ △DEF, ∠CBG, ∠EHD, 4 = BF, ∠GCB, CG, C on EF, ∠IHE

Step 2:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : DH ⊥ EH
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠EHD

Step 3:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : I on FH, ∠FHE
Conclusions: ∠FHE = ∠IHE

Step 4:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : CF, FI, CI
Conclusions: △CFI

Step 5:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : BG ⊥ CG
Conclusions: (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠CGB, pi / 2 = ∠BGC

Step 6:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠ICB, ∠ECI
Conclusions: pi = ∠ECI + ∠ICB

Step 7:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : I on DF, ∠CFD
Conclusions: ∠CFD = ∠CFI

Step 8:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : EH ⊥ FH
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠FHE, (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠EHF

Step 9:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠ACB, G on AC
Conclusions: ∠ACB = ∠GCB

Step 10:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠ACB, I on AC
Conclusions: ∠ACB = ∠ICB

Step 11:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠HEB, F on BE
Conclusions: ∠HEB = ∠HEF

Step 12:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠HEB, C on BE
Conclusions: ∠HEB = ∠HEC

Step 13:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠FIC, ∠CIH
Conclusions: pi = ∠CIH + ∠FIC

Step 14:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 2 = CF, 1 = CE
Conclusions: 3 = CE + CF

Step 15:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : F on BC
Conclusions: BC = BF + CF

Step 16:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on BC, ∠ICB
Conclusions: ∠ICB = ∠ICF

Step 17:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : FH, EF, EH
Conclusions: △EFH

Step 18:
Theorem: Definition of Quadrilateral
Premises : CE, HI, CI, EH
Conclusions: Quadrilateral(C, E, H, I)

Step 19:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : H on DF, ∠EFD
Conclusions: ∠EFD = ∠EFH

Step 20:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △ABC ~ △DEF
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = BC / EF, ∠ACB = ∠EFD

Step 21:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on BC, ∠CBG
Conclusions: ∠CBG = ∠FBG

Step 22:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 2 = CF, 4 = BF
Conclusions: 6 = BF + CF

Step 23:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠GCB, I on CG
Conclusions: ∠GCB = ∠ICB

Step 24:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : BC, BG, CG
Conclusions: △BCG

Step 25:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : C on EF
Conclusions: EF = CE + CF

Step 26:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on EF, ∠EFD
Conclusions: ∠CFD = ∠EFD

Step 27:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠IHE, ∠EHD
Conclusions: pi = ∠EHD + ∠IHE

Step 28:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(C, F, I)
Premises : △CFI
Conclusions: pi = ∠CFI + ∠FIC + ∠ICF

Step 29:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi = ∠ECI + ∠ICB, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠ECI + ∠ICB

Step 30:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠FHE, ∠FHE = ∠IHE, pi / 2 = ∠EHD
Conclusions: ∠EHD = ∠IHE

Step 31:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠CGB, (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠EHF
Conclusions: ∠CGB = ∠EHF

Step 32:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠HEB = ∠HEC, ∠HEB = ∠HEF
Conclusions: ∠HEC = ∠HEF

Step 33:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(E, F, H)
Premises : △EFH
Conclusions: pi = ∠EFH + ∠FHE + ∠HEF

Step 34:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Quadrilateral(I, H, E, C)
Premises : Quadrilateral(C, E, H, I)
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠CIH + ∠ECI + ∠HEC + ∠IHE

Step 35:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ACB = ∠GCB, ∠ACB = ∠EFD
Conclusions: ∠EFD = ∠GCB

Step 36:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ACB = ∠ICB, ∠ACB = ∠EFD
Conclusions: ∠EFD = ∠ICB

Step 37:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : BC = BF + CF, 6 = BF + CF
Conclusions: 6 = BC

Step 38:
Theorem: Pythagorean Theorem
Premises : BG ⊥ CG, △BCG
Conclusions: CG = SqrtOf(BC ** 2 - BG ** 2)

Step 39:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(G, C, B)
Premises : △BCG
Conclusions: pi = ∠BGC + ∠CBG + ∠GCB

Step 40:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : EF = CE + CF, 3 = CE + CF
Conclusions: 3 = EF

Step 41:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CFD = ∠EFD, ∠EFD = ∠EFH
Conclusions: ∠CFD = ∠EFH

Step 42:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠CFI + ∠FIC + ∠ICF
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠CFI + ∠FIC + ∠ICF

Step 43:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi = ∠EFH + ∠FHE + ∠HEF, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠EFH + ∠FHE + ∠HEF

Step 44:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EFD = ∠GCB, ∠EFD = ∠EFH
Conclusions: ∠EFH = ∠GCB

Step 45:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EFD = ∠EFH, ∠EFD = ∠ICB
Conclusions: ∠EFH = ∠ICB

Step 46:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 3 = BG, 6 = BC
Conclusions: 5.2 = SqrtOf(BC ** 2 - BG ** 2)

Step 47:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi = ∠BGC + ∠CBG + ∠GCB, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠BGC + ∠CBG + ∠GCB

Step 48:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CFD = ∠CFI, ∠CFD = ∠EFH
Conclusions: ∠CFI = ∠EFH

Step 49:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : pi = ∠EHD + ∠IHE, ∠EHD = ∠IHE, 3.14 = ∠EFH + ∠FHE + ∠HEF, ∠EFH = ∠ICB, 3.14 = ∠ECI + ∠ICB, 2 * pi = ∠CIH + ∠ECI + ∠HEC + ∠IHE, ∠HEC = ∠HEF, pi / 2 = ∠FHE, pi = ∠CIH + ∠FIC
Conclusions: ∠HEC = 0.5 * ∠FIC

Step 50:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ICB = ∠ICF, ∠EFH = ∠ICB
Conclusions: ∠EFH = ∠ICF

Step 51:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 5.2 = SqrtOf(BC ** 2 - BG ** 2), CG = SqrtOf(BC ** 2 - BG ** 2)
Conclusions: 5.2 = CG

Step 52:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EFD = ∠GCB, ∠EFD = ∠EFH, ∠CFI = ∠EFH
Conclusions: ∠CFI = ∠GCB

Step 53:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EFH = ∠ICF, ∠GCB = ∠ICB, ∠EFH = ∠ICB
Conclusions: ∠GCB = ∠ICF

Step 54:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠BGC, ∠CFI = ∠GCB, pi = ∠BGC + ∠CBG + ∠GCB, 3.14 = ∠BGC + ∠CBG + ∠GCB, 3.14 = ∠CFI + ∠FIC + ∠ICF, ∠GCB = ∠ICF
Conclusions: ∠CBG = 0.5 * ∠FIC

Step 55:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠HEC = 0.5 * ∠FIC, ∠CBG = ∠FBG, ∠CBG = 0.5 * ∠FIC
Conclusions: ∠FBG = ∠HEC

Step 56:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠FBG = ∠HEC, ∠CBG = ∠FBG, ∠HEC = ∠HEF
Conclusions: ∠CBG = ∠HEF

Step 57:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠CGB = ∠EHF, ∠EFH = ∠GCB, ∠CBG = ∠HEF
Conclusions: △BCG ~ △EFH

Step 58:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △BCG ~ △EFH
Conclusions: BC / EF = Perimeter(△BCG) / Perimeter(△EFH), sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h = Perimeter(△BCG) / Perimeter(△EFH), sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h = CG / FH, ∠EFH = ∠GCB, sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h = BC / EF, ∠CBG = ∠HEF

Step 59:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3 = EF, 6 = BC, BC / EF = Perimeter(△BCG) / Perimeter(△EFH)
Conclusions: 6 / 3 = Perimeter(△BCG) / Perimeter(△EFH)

Step 60:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = BC / EF, sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h = BC / EF
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h

Step 61:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h = Perimeter(△BCG) / Perimeter(△EFH), sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = Perimeter(△BCG) / Perimeter(△EFH)

Step 62:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h = CG / FH, sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = CG / FH

Step 63:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 6 / 3 = Perimeter(△BCG) / Perimeter(△EFH), sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = Perimeter(△BCG) / Perimeter(△EFH)
Conclusions: 6 / 3 = sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f

Step 64:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 6 / 3 = sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f, sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = CG / FH
Conclusions: 6 / 3 = CG / FH

Step 65:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 6 / 3 = CG / FH, 5.2 = CG
Conclusions: 2.6 = FH
logic_fomrs_refined: Similar(Triangle(A, B, C), Triangle(D, E, F))
